intro: Manulea gariesiana, commonly known as the Garies' manulea, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the high-altitude regions of eastern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its delicate, hairy foliage and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important subject for botanical research.
